author: Victoria Norwich
reviewBody: Not Verified | It's inconceivable that ONT International airport has to delay flight until the sun melts the ice off wings of planes. Frontier Airlines should have left at 5.45 a.m. and they could not de ice their plane ruining everyone's connections. Still sitting waiting for the sun to rise and maybe melt ice despite temperature will be the same at 7.32 a.m. Incompetent and typical for California

author: K Sal
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I love flying Ontario Airport. It’s convenient, never busy like the LAX nightmare. It’s small fast and convenient. They have China Airlines flights but not many International flights. Popular flights to Las Vegas Hawaii and Seattle. Nice and clean.

author: Jeannie A Gephart
reviewBody: Not Verified |  This is the rudest airport I have ever been to. Nothing but issues. Issues with going through security with a 1 yr old and all they did was yell and did not seem to understand or even help. I will never fly to or from this airport again and I will be letting family and friends know how the experience was. Also the place is very dirty and disgusting.

author: S Grafton
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Well, obviously no one reads this or even cares about it as nothing happens and my issues are similar to the ones everyone else is having. Staff are extremely uncooperative and using language that is not understandable. A person just said, “You alarmed” as if we were supposed to know what that means. Next thing we know is that they need to check our hands because we could be hiding something on our hands. Next thing they say it’s just lotion or something. Does the advanced technology that we use not tell the difference between harmful substance and lotion? I know nothing will happen from this as no one even cares, especially those from the airport, but someone does need to care.

author: K Cox
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I have flown into this airport several times and have consistently experienced long waits for rental car shuttle buses. The buses are sometimes too small to handle the waiting crowd and are never timely. The airport apparently doesn’t know how to update what baggage claim bags arrive into also.

author: W Wendy
reviewBody:
Not Verified |  
They are restricting Uber/Lyft but there should be a Cab at Airport. We have to call a cab to go to the Airport which is ok but when we arrived there was no cab. We tried to call several cab companies but they would not come to the Airport. There should be phone numbers listed so it would be easy for Arriving passengers. When we got a cab the driver told us that due to some reasons no one wants to come to the Airport so there are very little cabs available. We travel lots so used John Wayne, LAX, San Diego Airport but this one was the worst experience on getting transportation. How you can develop airport without proper transportation?

author: F Jenkins
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  At 6am on a Monday morning there were literally hundreds of people waiting to go through security. Clearly everyone is frustrated with this idiocy. I travel for a living and I can tell you this is unacceptable and incredibly incompetent to be so understaffed and unprepared. Foolishness.

header: "staff member at security spoke poor English"
author: Kayla Krueger
reviewBody: Incoming flight to Ontario was good, departing flight no lines and we had a TSA PreCheck. Staff member at security spoke poor English and we could not understand what they wanted us to do, made us take off our shoes even with the TSA pre-check. Not very clear for giving instructions. If you work in the United States you should be able to communicate clearly in English.

author: P Burqe
reviewBody: Red eye to Dallas on American. Easy drop off, but it's a ghost town. Absurd that you can't bring drinks or food through security. Every single vendor was closed. Hadn't flown out of Ontario in over ten years, I use LAX, SNA, and Long Beach. Don't see me using Ontario again any time soon.

author: Max Davidson
reviewBody: One of the easiest airports to access both inbound and outbound that we have ever experienced. Staff on the information desk in Terminal 4 were extremely pleasant and helpful when we asked for assistance. Public areas very clean and well kept. Plenty of seating for passengers. Great food outlets and some interesting local shops as well. A real treat to travel through this southern California airport.

author: L Pulliam
reviewBody: Mixed feelings about this small airport. Easy check-in but the security line was extremely long. Over an hour waiting in line as they only had one station open. Limited services after security with some shops closed. Just seems like lots of wasted space. The airport is a good location if you are going to that area of Southern California. I've used this airport several times and it is usually fairly quiet but this last time and the security mess left me unsure about what all was going on.

author: S Koenig
reviewBody: Generally uncrowded. As noted not close to much of LA but we were visiting family in the Ontario area. Once outside the terminal confusing signage as to which of the islands in the airport road one need to go to for the consolidated rental car facility's shuttle van and if you pick the wrong one it's almost impossible to get from one island to the other with a cart so I had to go back to the terminal first (I'd imagine it'd be the same for a wheelchair). The shuttle was crowded and driver offered no help in loading bags (other passengers helped). We've always run into a very small variety of rental cars at this airport (even Burbank is better). But all in all at least less crowded and easier to use than LAX.

author: S Symon
reviewBody: Food outlets were expensive but pretty much on par with other US airports. Security was a breeze and there were good views of the runways. Airport is not particularly close to the rest of the LA area so it's not surprising they are losing passengers. It was also impossible to get there using public transportation.

author: S King
reviewBody: Remains an easy to use airport facility but also one with limited facilities. Some of the limited number of stores and eateries appear to have closed or have very limited hours. No airline clubs. Traffic around the airport is almost non-existent. Lines for security can be very long or very short depending on the time of day. American Airlines for example has only morning departures.

author: S Koenig
reviewBody: A relatively quiet airport - there's even been talk of consolidating operations in its two main terminals into just one - and easy to access. Rental car facilities are consolidated in one location which is good (eg easy to shop among companies) but it does require use of a shuttle bus that can get crowded. There are no eating facilities outside of security and the choice inside security is pretty limited. No airline clubs at all. Lines for security were average.

author: D Welty
reviewBody: I travel monthly for business and Ontario International is my airport of choice. Living in Southern California I have the choice of 4 major airports within an hours drive. Ontario is easy to get to modern and has fast security lines. I have only had a delayed flight once and it was mechanical. Luggage service is fast and efficient.

author: Leo Enticknap
reviewBody: Arrival was straightforward and painless: my luggage was on the carousel within 10-15 minutes there was hardly any wait for the car rental shuttle and I was soon on my way. The return departure was less satisfactory. Because Delta's website would not let me check-in online I followed the instructions for airport check-in and arrived two hours in advance of the scheduled departure time (0410 for an 0610 departure). It was over an hour before any agents showed up to check me in by which time a long and irate queue had formed. All the other airlines were up running and checking pax in by 0430 but Delta was not and we were given no explanation for the delay. Of course by the time I was through security there was no time for any breakfast before the flight. And even if there had been there seemed to be only one airside place open serving breakfast and that had a queue to be seated. I would probably use ONT again as it is only 15 miles or so from where I stay regularly in California and the queues usually aren't anything like as bad as at LAX (especially to go through security) but this airport does seriously need to improve its customer service.

author: Derek Greenaway
reviewBody: Situated some 60 minutes from LAX direct with access to the 10 freeway quite a good option for travel into California. The airport was taken over by LAX a few years ago but they are starting to limit the flights there and promoting their main airport. The airport was built to provide up to 20 million passengers a year but in fact only about 5 million will probably use the site this year. The airport is pretty laid back with not bad facilities check in is easy and collection of baggage quite straight forward. Word is that the local municipal will take over the running in the next couple of years this would see an injection to make the facilities more appealing. The first improvement needs to be to eating facilities. Car hire is a couple of minutes shuttle away. On site long term packing at $9 a day seems a bit expensive.

author: S Koenig
reviewBody: Rather quiet airport especially when compared with other area airports such as LAX and to a lesser extent Orange County. I quickly turned in our rental car and took the shuttle back to the terminal where I'd left my wife with our bags. We checked in quickly even at Southwest Airlines. Curbside check-in is readily available. Security lines were short and moved quickly. There aren't many places at which to eat and aren't necessarily the highest in quality but we found someplace to satisfy our needs.

author: Steve Koenig
reviewBody: We arrived here shortly before Xmas and ours was the only plane at the terminal (where Continental United and Delta are; the terminal where Southwest is had a couple of planes there). On departure lines were short at the airline counter and almost non-existent to go through security. As noted there is a dearth of eateries there and none at all outside of security (so if you are waiting for an arriving passenger bring your own eats). There are no airline clubs. But it is certainly less hectic than LAX and others. We saved on rental car prices by going to an off-airport location. There are plenty of hotels in the area many with shuttles.

author: F Zack
reviewBody: We frequently fly into Ontario airport as it is the closest low prices airport to Palm Springs. The new buildings are a huge improvement over the old huts of years ago. However you should be warned that the few poor quality food and bar services close very early in the evening and late in the mornings. Unfortunately that is when we usually are arriving or departing. Our last trip after Tgi Fridays was already closed at 7pm we followed the food signs all the way to the end of Terminal 4 only to find the cafe had not even been completed - coming soon.

author: S Koenig
reviewBody: Ontario has lost a few airlines including Jet Blue so it is even quieter than in the past. There are two terminals. A low-key alternative to LAX assuming of course you can find a flight and the price is no higher. There are a number of hotels nearby with free shuttles from/to the airport.
